Description: Bronze lamp with a shallow, sharply carinated body, wide curved shoulders, and a long narrow voluted nozzle. The small filling-hole is surrounded by a raised rim. On the left side is a suspension-lug in the form of a duck's head; on the right is a raised stud. At the rear is a double ribbed handle with bud-shaped upper springs. The lid is hinged on top of the handle, and is decorated with a mouse eating. The wide base-ring is slightly concave within.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q3549)
